alert.note: Alert for Baker; Bradford; Union; Western Clay (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 12 at 9:00AM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...GUSTY SHOWERS WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN BRADFORD...SOUTHEASTERN BAKER...NORTHEASTERN UNION AND NORTHWESTERN CLAY COUNTIES THROUGH 930 AM EDT... At 900 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking gusty showers capable of producing a landspout over Lake Butler, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts and wind gusts around 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lake Butler, Raiford, Beasley, Johnstown, and Ellerbee. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 PM EDT for northern and northeastern Florida.
